standardCivics.name: Agrarian Idyll
standardCivics.description: A simple and peaceful life can often be the most rewarding. This agrarian society has, to a large extent, managed to avoid large-scale urbanization.
effects: +1 Housing from Generator, Mining and Agriculture districts
+2 Ameneties from Farmers, Anglers, and Pearl Divers
+1 Building slot per every 4 Agriculture districts (+0.025 each
Can research the Agrarian Utopias technology
Cannot research the Anti_Gravity Engineering technology
Cannot pick the Arcology Project ascension perk

councilPosition.description: The Elder Farmer oversees farming traditions and practices.

standardCivics.name: Anglers
standardCivics.description: Adept at utilizing nature's bounty, this society provides for itself a stable influx of sustenance and economic value.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Main species must have the Aquatic trait
No Agriculture district limit on Ocean Worlds
Replaces Farmer jobs with an Angler job on wet climates
Agriculture districts create Pearl Diver jobs on wet climates
-50 Agriculture district minerals cost on wet climates

councilPosition.description: The Minister of the Seas is in charge of sea conservation and harvesting.

standardCivics.name: Aristocratic Elite
standardCivics.description: This society has an entrenched nobility that occupies the upper echelons of society.
effects: Capital Buildings replase some Politician jobs with Noble jobs

councilPosition.description: The Lord Steward upholds the status and comforts of the ruling class.

standardCivics.name: Ascensionists
standardCivics.description: The ultimate goal of this empire is to ascend to ever greater levels of fulfillment

councilPosition.description: The Minister of Ascension leads the pursuit of perfection.

standardCivics.name: Barbaric Despoilers
standardCivics.description: This society holds few things sacred. To fight is to live, and the strongest may seize whatever they covet.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Can use the Despoliation casus belli
Can use the Raiding orbital bombardment stance
Can only create Martial Alliance and Hegemony federations
Reduced opinion from empires that don't have this civic

councilPosition.description: The Labor Intendant is responsible for slave administration and supervision.

standardCivics.name: Beacon of Liberty
standardCivics.description: This society is a shining beacon of light in a sea of darkness. Liberty and individual freedoms are held in the highest regard here.

councilPosition.description: The Protector of Liberty is a champion of freedom.

standardCivics.name: Byzantine Bureaucracy
standardCivics.description: This society is largely governed by a complex and, to the outsider, almost labyrinthine system of bureaucracy. An army of officials and functionaries work tirelessly to keep the government running smoothly and ensure no citizens are allocated resources they cannot demonstrate a properly filed and triple-stamped need for.

councilPosition.description: The Administrative Coordinator is in charge of coordinating the efforts of all administrative departments.

standardCivics.name: Catalytic Processing
standardCivics.description: By focusing their industrial efforts into catalytic chemistry, this civilization has unlocked the key to using organic materials in the construction of spacebound structures.
effects: Replaces Metallurgist jobs with Catalytic Technician jobs

councilPosition.description: The Principal Catalyst oversees augmentation of catalytic raw materials.

standardCivics.name: Citizen Service
standardCivics.description: Are you doing your part? Full citizenship and the political responsibility that comes with it is limited to those who have served a tour of duty in the military. Service guarantees citizenship.
effects: Full Citizenship pops must have full Military Service and vice versa

councilPosition.description: The Chief of Service is in charge of army training and reinforcement.

standardCivics.name: Corv√©e System
standardCivics.description: This society considers it the absolute right of the state to decide where its citizens live and work.
effects: Removes unity costs for pop resetlement

councilPosition.description: The Employment Commissioner oversees the distribution of labor assignments.

standardCivics.name: Crusader Spirit
standardCivics.description: The lack of guidance creates weak minds - which easily succumb to corruption and plunge into decadence. This society has assumed the self-imposed mantle of bringing enlightenment to the masses through aggressive proselytizing.
effects: War Philosophy is locked to Liberation Wars

councilPosition.description: The Lord Commander is responsible for leading the armies of the righteous and planning battle tactics.

standardCivics.name: Cutthroat Politics
standardCivics.description: The political system in this society is renowned for its intrigue. Power struggles, shady backroom deals and cloak and dagger scheming are par for the course. Those who survive long enough to learn the game, however, tend to learn it well.

councilPosition.description: The Prime Speaker will stop at nothing to achieve results.

standardCivics.name: Distinguished Admirality
standardCivics.description: The Fleet and the Admiralty have unusually prominent roles in this society, wielding a great deal of influence in political circles. They have the pick of the litter when it comes to new military recruits.

councilPosition.description: The Lord Commander is responsible for leading the armies of the righteous and planning battle tactics.

standardCivics.name: Eager Explorers
standardCivics.description: Yearning for the stars, this civilization sped through several stages of development, reaching the age of galactic exploration far earlier than most.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Start with the Subspace Drive techology
Start with a second science ship
Certain starting techologies are not researched but available as permanent options

councilPosition.description: The Minister of Exploration is in charge of special studies and expeditions.

standardCivics.name: Efficient Bureaucracy
standardCivics.description: This society is renowned for its efficiency. Not only do the mag-trains run on time, but the colossal bureaucratic apparatus required to run an interstellar nation has been greatly streamlined.
effects: Bureaucrat and Priest category jobs produce Edict Fund equal to their Unity output

councilPosition.description: The Superintendent is in charge of streamlining all administrative processes.

standardCivics.name: Environmentalist
standardCivics.description: This society seeks to co-exist in harmony with nature. Great care is taken to preserve the environment and limit consumerism where possible.
effects: Start with a Ranger Lodge building

councilPosition.description: The First Warden protects the environment and those living in harmony with it.

standardCivics.name: Exalted Priesthood
standardCivics.description: To guard against heresy, this society is ruled by a religious council consisting of the wisest and most pious members of the clergy.
effects: Capital Buildings replace some Politican jobs with High Priest jobs

councilPosition.description: The Archpriest presides over the religious council and guards against heresy.

standardCivics.name: Fanatic Purifiers
standardCivics.description: This society appears hellbent on scouring the galaxy of all other sapient life. Come what may, they will suffer no xenos to live.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start

councilPosition.description: The Minister of War Production ensures resources are available to sustain military operations.

standardCivics.name: Feudal Society
standardCivics.description: This society is organized in a feudal manner, with a monarch whose rule relies on powerful vassals that govern their territories with considerable autonomy.
effects: -400 Unity per level of dismissed leaders
No loyalty loss from multiple subjects
Cannot use Expansion Prohibited terms of agreement
Cannot use Limited Diplomacy terms of agreement

councilPosition.description: The Chief Herald of Arms oversees the distribution of power and titles among subjects.

standardCivics.name: Free Haven
standardCivics.description: This society has a well-earned reputation as a free haven. The tired, the poor, the huddled masses yearning to breathe free - all are welcome here, regardless of their species or origin.

councilPosition.description: The Integration Facilitator is in charge of integration and employment of new citizens.

standardCivics.name: Functional Architecture
standardCivics.description: This society is renowned for its simple yet functional architecture. There are those who would refer to this building style as boring or even depressing, but in most cases, concrete does the job just as well as any other building material.

councilPosition.description: The Master Architect ensures simplicity and lean practices are upheld and valued.

standardCivics.name: Heroic Past
standardCivics.description: The legendary heroes of the past inspire this civilizations young people to achieve the extraordinary. As role models, government officials are expected to embody these ideals.

councilPosition.description: Stories from the past contain much wisdom. Grand Storytellers inspire the population with traditional heroic tales.

standardCivics.name: Idealistic Foundation
standardCivics.description: This society was founded on strong idealistic values. Whether the current government remains true to them or not, the people have not forgotten.

councilPosition.description: The Tribune of Rights protects the rights of citizens, building trust in society and government.

standardCivics.name: Idyllic Bloom
standardCivics.description: This society has always spent much time on improving and caring for their environment, in pursuit of building a true paradise for its inhabitants.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Can construct and upgrade Gaia Seeders buildings
Can construct Gaia Seeder Outpost holdings
Start with a Gaia Seeders - Phase 1 building
Disabled by synthetic ascension special project

councilPosition.description: The Bloom Herald oversees all Gaia Seeder initiatives.

standardCivics.name: Imperial Cult
standardCivics.description: This society has a dominant state religion where the ruler is worshiped as a living deity.

councilPosition.description: The Prime Herald is in charge of our spiritual narrative.

standardCivics.name: Inward Perfection
standardCivics.description: This calm and pacifist society has little use for strangers who do not understand their way of life. More than anything, they would prefer to be left alone.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start

councilPosition.description: The Commander of the Watch is in charge of the vigilant watch protecting our borders.

standardCivics.name: Masterful Crafters
standardCivics.description: A penchant for meticulous crafting lies at the heart of this society. Deft appendages and keen sensory organs aid them in creating truly wondrous treasures even in the most basic of trades.
effects: Replaces Artisan jobs with Artificers jobs
+1 Building slot per 3 Industrialist districts (except on Habitats) (+0.34 each)

councilPosition.description: The Master Crafter oversees craftsmanship in military applications.

standardCivics.name: Memorialists
standardCivics.description: This empire pays tribute to memories and sapients of the past, deriving greater stability and insight from the continuous cycles of death, rebirth and legacy.
effects: Autochthon Monument buildings are replaced by Sanctuary of Repose buildings
Gain additional Unity from Leviathan Parade Oppurtunity Situations

councilPosition.description: The High Curator oversees the Memorial Sanctuaries.

standardCivics.name: Merchant Guilds
standardCivics.description: A number of powerful and very influential merchant guilds have risen to prominent positions in this society. They hold significant sway with the government.
effects: Capital Buildings replace some Politician jobs with Merchant jobs
Can use the Mercantile Diplomatic Stance (unless also Inward Perfection

councilPosition.description: The Director of Trade is responsible for generating trade.

standardCivics.name: Meritocracy
standardCivics.description: An individual's social station or personal connections should have no bearing on their profession. The sole basis for advancement in this society is demonstrated ability and talent.

councilPosition.description: The Principal Instructor oversees training and development for all important leaders.

standardCivics.name: Mining Guilds
standardCivics.description: Several large mining guilds have reached a dominant position in this society. The government relies heavily on their support.

councilPosition.description: The Chairman of the Mines represents the mining guilds, whose influence helps to maintain order.

standardCivics.name: Mutagenic Spas
standardCivics.description: This civilization engages in ritualistic mutagenic bathing, with professional attendants overseeing the use of highly dangerous substances. This 'invigorating' process may appall uninitiated onlookers.

councilPosition.description: The Warden of the Baths promotes the importance and benefits of the bathing rituals.

standardCivics.name: Nationalistic Zeal
standardCivics.description: A strong sense of nationalistic pride permeates all layers of this society.

councilPosition.description: The Standard Bearer is the champion and pride of our society.

standardCivics.name: Oppressive Autocracy
standardCivics.description: Only the elite of the elite deserve the best of the best. Everyone else is expected to provide for the ruling class and their lackeys.
effects: Cannot be added or removed after game start
Must use the Dystopian Society living standard
Start with a Presinct Houses building
Only Rulers and Enforcers produce and use Amenities

councilPosition.description: The Primary Overseer seeks out corruption and extinguishes it before it can spread.

standardCivics.name: Parlimentary System
standardCivics.description: The parliamentary system in this society encourages a free and lively debate. Currying favor with one of the dominant political factions can prove to be quite advantageous.

councilPosition.description: The Speaker of Parliament ensures our parliament is focusing on the most relevant issues.

standardCivics.name: Philosopher King
standardCivics.description: It is not enough to simply rule. The Ship of State must be guided by a king that wields enough wisdom and knowledge to steer it true.

councilPosition.description: The Lord Chancellor serves to advise the council in all matters.

standardCivics.name: Pleasure Seekers
standardCivics.description: This society rejoices in its own perfection. Those who are elevated by their privileged social structure have surrendered to a culture which glorifies pleasure and entertainment, regardless of a cost typically borne by others.
effects: Can use the Decadent Lifestyle living standard

councilPosition.description: The Minister of Extravagance wields a substantial budget for keeping the privileged lavishly entertained.

standardCivics.name: Police State
standardCivics.description: To quash any traces of dissent, the population in this repressive society is carefully monitored and controlled by a large internal police force.

councilPosition.description: The Chief of Secret Police ensures any internal threats or dissidents within our society are swiftly dealt with.

standardCivics.name: Pompous Purists
standardCivics.description: A society so utterly convinced of their own superiority, that any attempt at diplomacy not initated by themselves will be utterly ignored.

councilPosition.description: The Grand Marshal is a ceremonial position for impressing alien dignitaries.

standardCivics.name: Reanimators
standardCivics.description: Within this society, death is no bar to the call of arms. Masters of the art of necromancy reanimate deceased corpses to raise a dread host that strikes fear into the hearts of lesser mortals.
effects: Military Academy buildings are replaced by Dread Encampment buildings
33% chance to gain an Undead Army per killed organic army
Defeated organic guardians can be resurrected

councilPosition.description: The Master Necromancer guards the secret arts and ordains new necromancers.

standardCivics.name: Relentless Industrialists
standardCivics.description: To live is to exploit. This civilization is built around the principle of living life to the fullest, in the sense of squeezing the maximum profit from every last ounce of matter and membrane available for exploitation.
effects: Can construct Coordinated Coordinated Fulfillment Center buildings
Strat wtih a Coordinated Fulfillment Center building
First time a world is polluted triggers the Environmental Deterioration situation

councilPosition.description: The Chief Extraction Officer will exploit anyone and anything to ensure industrial expansion.

standardCivics.name: Scavanger
standardCivics.description: In this society, nothing goes to waste, even in the grimmest times of war: no enemy technology will go undiscovered, as teams of scrappers accompanying the war fleets scrape wreckages of anything and everything worth salvaging.
effects: Enables the Research & Salavage Debris debris policy
10% chance per ship debris to create a a ship of equal size

councilPosition.description: The Master Scrapper is in charge of refining the salvaging process of scavenged ships.

standardCivics.name: Shadow Council
standardCivics.description: Unbeknownst to its own citizens, this society is actually manipulated from behind the scenes by a secretive shadow council. Appearances must be kept, but the tyranny of the majority should also be guarded against. After all, what if the fools vote for the wrong candidate?

councilPosition.description: Officially, the Shadow Councilor is merely an observer, but may have a hidden agenda.

standardCivics.name: Shared Burdens
standardCivics.description: This society believes in an equitable distribution of resources, making little to no distinction between the needs of ruler and ruled. All work together for the benefit of the whole.
effects: Can use the Shared Burden living standard
Cannot use other Living Standards except Utopian Abundance and Chemical Blizz
Can build Communal Housing and Utopian Communal Housing buildings
Can construct Communal Housing Outreach holdings

councilPosition.description: The Head Arbiter makes sure any grievances are settled promptly.

standardCivics.name: Slave Guilds
standardCivics.description: Much of the true political power in this society rests with a number of powerful and ruthless slaver guilds. They know how to get the most out of a slave.

councilPosition.description: The Labor Magistrate oversees the treatment of slaves, to prevent unnecessary bloodshed.

standardCivics.name: Technocracy
standardCivics.description: To maximize efficiency, this society is governed according to the principles of science and rationality. The personal whims of an ignorant and dangerously unqualified political elite must not be allowed to interfere.
effects: Capital Buildings replace some Politician jobs with Science Director jobs
Scientists start with a random Expertise trait

councilPosition.description: The Senior Science Director ensures fundamental research is promoted and shared between departments.

standardCivics.name: Vaults of Knowledge
standardCivics.description: The knowledge, principles, and experiences of exceptional people are digitized and accumulated in the Vaults of Knowledge. Citizens can access this source of wisdom and experience to learn from the ghosts of the past.
effects: Can construct Vaults of Knowledge buildings
Start with a Vaults of Knowledge building

councilPosition.description: The Keeper of the Vaults is responsible for maintaining vast archives of knowledge stored deep in vaults, and distributing this knowledge to those who seek it.

standardCivics.name: Warrior Culture
standardCivics.description: This society has developed into a hardy warrior culture. Martial prowess is valued above all else, and true glory can only be found on the field of battle.

councilPosition.description: The Arbiter of Duels is responsible for maintaining dueling etiquette, and overseeing the correct execution of warfare protocols.
